title: Treating Infected Wounds
brief: How to treat wound infections when antibiotics are not available.
steps: Place warm, moist compress directly on infected wound.
Change compress when it cools, maintaining warmth for total of 30 minutes.
Drain the wound by opening and gently probing with sterile instrument.
Dress and bandage the wound after drainage.
Drink large amounts of water to help fight infection.
Continue daily treatment until all signs of infection disappear.
warnings: Signs of infection include pain, swelling, redness, increased temperature, and pus
Severe infections may require maggot therapy as last resort
Use only sterile instruments for probing infected wounds
